attributes.action: Do not give Covid19 financial aid to companies or individuals using tax havens.
attributes.additional_details: Denmark, Poland and France have each put in place measures for the post coronavirus recovery programme which should be adopted as a model to repeat here in the UK, this plan includes excluding any companies and their subsidiaries registered in tax havens from claiming state financial aid. The act of circumventing tax law and removing value from our economy should not be encouraged or rewarded.
attributes.background: Prevent companies either registered, or controlling subsidiaries in tax havens from claiming covid-19 financial relief. Including individuals who use banking services in tax havens.

Find out more and watch the Committee put questions suggested by petitioners to Government Ministers and the Deputy Chief Medical Officer: https://committees.parliament.uk/committee/326/petitions-committee/news/145767/committee-question-deputy-chief-medical-officer-and-ministers-on-coronavirus-response/
